instruction: Name a bacteria deadly for humans.
output: One of the most deadly bacteria for humans is Yersinia pestis, which is responsible for the Bubonic Plague. It is an aerobic, Gram-negative rod-shaped bacterium and is a member of the Enterobacteriaceae family. The plague is an infectious disease caused by the deadliest of the Yersinae species, Y. pestis. This bacteria is capable of causing serious illness and even death. It was one of the most devastating pandemics in human history.
